availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Solomon Sachs (Louisville, Kentucky, dry goods merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, merchant. Native of Bavaria. Dry goods merchant in partnership with Alexander Sachs and Benedict Sachs in Sachs & Brothers in Louisville in 1858 and 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 5, p. 208.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, X County, Louisville, District 9, p. 220B.
Louisville City Directory and Business Mirror for 1858-9, (Louisville: Hurd & Burrows, 1859), 150.
Tannerâ€™s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 ed. Henry Tanner (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 213.
"Marshal's Sale" The Louisville Daily Journal, (Louisville, KY), April 9, 1859, p. 2.
